{{Description|Stars burst 'neath the frosted skies.}}
'''Starfrost Swirl''' is [[Mika]]'s [[Elemental Skill]].

==Gameplay Notes==
* {{Talent Note|particles|Flowfrost Arrow or Rimestar Flare|4}}
* Rimestar Flare makes a viewfinder-like circle appears on the screen, which surrounds the aiming cursor. Rimestar Flare locks on the enemy that was in the circle, and unlocks on that enemy if the enemy moved away or if Mika turned away. If no enemy is locked, Rimestar Flare will be fired based on the aiming cursor, which is still able to hit enemies, explode into Rimestar Shards, and yield Elemental Particles.
* Rimestar Flare can only lock on enemies, including most hostile [[wildlife]]. Objects such as [[Elemental Monument]]s, [[Regisvines]]' shields, [[Shouki no Kami]]'s Nirvana Engines, [[Spider]]s, and [[Defense Mechanism]]s will not be locked on. However, they can be hit by it if the skill is fired manually by aiming.
** [[Wildlife]] and enemies that are in a state where they would not be [[Aggravation|aggravated]] upon approach will still be locked on.
** Hostile wildlife that does not cause the player to enter combat mode, such as [[Forest Boar]]s, cannot be locked on.
* If locked on, Rimestar Flare will home in on its target.
** Due to this, Mika cannot use his crossbow to target [[Weak Point]]s while locked on, as the auto-targeting system does not aim for Weak Points. However, a manually-aimed Rimestar Flare fired from outside of the lock-on range can still hit Weak Points, although a [[CRIT Hit]] will not be guaranteed.
* Rimestar Flare's flying trajectory is notably different from the normal Bow Charged Attack. Its trajectory falls off faster.
* Mika can hold the skill for a maximum of '''10''' seconds. The skill is automatically released afterwards.

==Trivia==
* Using this skill on some idle enemies (not those in special idle animations) will cause them to walk over to the location of the fired shot to "investigate" before they may walk back. This behavior is similar to a normal {{Cryo}} arrow.
